channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Nvidia surpasses Tesla as the No. 1 held stock on Robinhood, fueled by Gen Z interest
item.description: Is Nvidia still a worthwhile investment? Despite recent market headwinds, investors—especially young ones—are still bullish.

item.title: Russian Mercenary Found Guilty of War Crimes in Ukraine by Finland Court
item.description: Voislav Torden, a commander in a Russian paramilitary group, was sentenced to life in prison for the attack and mutilation of Ukrainian soldiers in 20...

item.title: Duterte Appears in Court in The Hague via Video After Arrest
item.description: The former leader of the Philippines has been charged with crimes against humanity after thousands of civilians were killed during his time in office.

item.title: Scott Bessent says the U.S. economy is detoxing but that doesn’t mean there will be a recession: ‘I’m not concerned about a little bit of volatility over three weeks’
item.description: The Treasury secretary echoed recent statements from President Donald Trump and Vice President JD Vance.

item.title: Hamas Says It’s Willing to Release U.S.-Israeli Hostage Edan Alexander
item.description: Hamas said it agreed to release Edan Alexander and turn over the bodies of four other hostages. Israel accused Hamas of “psychological warfare,” sugge...

item.title: Why lowering the yield on 10-year bonds is more important to Trump than the stock market or interest rates
item.description: Roughly six in 10 U.S. adults report owning stock, but nearly 80% of American households have some type of debt.

item.title: Illinois debated ditching its 110-year-old state flag—but voters overwhelmingly prefer a design that experts ‘hate’
item.description: "People overwhelmingly prefer our current state flag,” said Illinois Secretary of State Alexi Giannoulias.

item.title: Germans Reach Deal to Spend Big on Defense, Climate and More
item.description: The agreement between centrist parties, led by the likely next chancellor, Friedrich Merz, was billed as a response to America’s shrinking security gu...

item.title: Why Is Gavin Newsom Seeking Common Ground With the Right?
item.description: Democrats are desperate for leaders who will fight on their behalf, not flatter their enemies.

item.title: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick blasts Canada for ‘tone deaf’ tariff response and praises the UK and Mexico for not retaliating
item.description: Lutnick also criticized Canada because it contributes less to NATO than the U.S.
